description:
My life was full of boredom. Until I met him.

“That’s a hassle.”
That was second-year high schooler Nagi Seishirou’s favorite phrase as he lived his dull life. Until Reo Mikage, a classmate who dreamed of winning the World Cup, discovered Nagi’s hidden skill, inspiring him to play soccer and share his outstanding talent. Nagi is pulled into Reo's world of soccer and out of his leisurely lifestyle. What fate awaits this prodigy in BLUE LOCK?: A world he’s never known.

(Source: Crunchyroll, edited)
synonyms: 劇場版 ブルーロック

node.description: Graduated from Osaka Prefectural Imamiya High School. Graduated from the Manga Produce Course, Faculty of Manga, Kyoto Seika University.
Graduated from Osaka Prefectural Imamiya High School. Graduated from the Manga Produce Course, Faculty of Manga, Kyoto Seika University.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Website](https://junmurayama.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/jun_murayama)

__Introduction:__
Jun Murayama is a Japanese musician, known for doing music composition and arrangement, while also being a music producer, pianist and keyboardist. He is also a member of the bands Venomstrip and FLOWER FLOWER.

__Biography:__
He started playing the piano at the age of three, then later on as a third year college student, he started his professional career after being scouted by the Light Music Club. Following this he joined [Koichi Domoto's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koichi_Domoto) tour, whom he knew from college.

He's mostly known as the keyboardist to the four-piece rock band FLOWER FLOWER with the stage name mura☆jun, which he joined in 2013. In the band his name was mistakenly introduced as 松潤 (Matsujun) when referring to members, so  instead of his actual stage name mura☆jun the fans have nicknamed him as such.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1248440090923171840)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with Studio Live.

She started first gaining attention among fans on [Hunter x Hunter (2011)](https://anilist.co/anime/11061/), in which she was highly praised for her work as one of the regular animation directors. In 2015, she made her debut as a character designer on [Ushio and Tora](https://anilist.co/anime/21038/) and also served as the sole chief animation director over its three-cour run.
